page.title: 01PAKEFIELD TO KESSINGLAND
page.content: Our area is divided between land and sea. The shingle beach is the home for several 'longshore' boats which make up the local {fishing} fleet. There is a low cliff on the edge of which stands a medieval church, destroyed during World War II and completely rebuilt in its original style. To the north there is a concentrated residential area and a growing industrial estate. Much of our area is agricultural land, used for both livestock and for arable {farming}. Tourism is encouraged by a holiday camp which caters for a large number of holiday makers each year. A busy trunk road passes through our area, carrying many types of vehicles but public {transport} is infrequent. There is evidence of past {industry} as well as a varied ecology.
